alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 12 at 4:15PM MST until June 12 at 5:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 515 PM MST. * At 414 PM MST, areas of blowing dust are near Arizona City, or 7 miles southeast of Casa Grande, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 186 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 162 and 178. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 124 and 142. Locations impacted include... Casa Grande, Coolidge, Arizona City, La Palma, Blackwater, Toltec, Arizola, Randolph, Coolidge Airport and Stanfield. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
